intro: Matelea caudata, commonly known as the long-tailed matelea, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and other toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink and yellow. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Matelea caudata is often found in desert or semi-desert environments, where it plays a role in local ecosystems.
